intro: Henleophytum echinatum, commonly known as the spiny henleophytum, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiny leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical rainforests. Its flowers, which are often brightly colored, attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
